parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description:
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.

You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. The client token can contain only ASCII characters.

>  If you do not specify this parameter, the system automatically uses the **request ID** as the **client token**. The **request ID** may be different for each request.

parameters.name: NewWeight
parameters.description:
The new weight of the policy-based route. Valid values:

*   **100**: The IPsec-VPN connection associated with the policy-based route serves as an active connection.
*   **0**: The IPsec-VPN connection associated with the policy-based route serves as a standby connection.

parameters.name: NextHop
parameters.description: The next hop of the policy-based route.

parameters.name: OverlayMode
parameters.description: The tunneling protocol. The value is set to **Ipsec**, which indicates the IPsec tunneling protocol.

parameters.name: Priority
parameters.description:
The priority of the policy-based route.

*   If the route was not assigned a priority, this parameter is optional.

*   If the route was assigned a priority, this parameter is optional.

        If you specify this parameter, set the value to the priority that was assigned to the policy-based route. Otherwise, the operation fails.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description: The ID of the region where the VPN gateway is created. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~36063~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: RouteDest
parameters.description: The destination CIDR block of the policy-based route.

parameters.name: RouteSource
parameters.description: The source CIDR block of the policy-based route.

parameters.name: VpnGatewayId
parameters.description: The ID of the VPN gateway.

parameters.name: Weight
parameters.description:
The original weight of the policy-based route. Valid values:

*   **100**: The IPsec-VPN connection associated with the policy-based route serves as an active connection.
*   **0**: The IPsec-VPN connection associated with the policy-based route serves as a standby connection.
